name: Melbury Beacon walk, Fontmell and Melbury Downs

ai.summary: A 7.1 km moderate hike across the Fontmell and Melbury Downs to Melbury Beacon, featuring open chalk downs, ridge viewpoints, and a rewarding summit experience for hikers with moderate fitness.
ai.terrain_summary: Open chalk grassland with gentle to moderate ascents, sections of exposed ridge, gates and fences, and well-defined paths leading to the beacon.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and daylight hours; wear sturdy waterproof footwear; stay on marked paths; bring water and a light layer for wind at the summit; be mindful of cattle on the downs; carry a map or GPS and know your route; keep dogs under control and close to you; tell someone your plan.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) for best conditions and visibility.

seo.title: Melbury Beacon Walk – Fontmell and Melbury Downs (7.1 km, Moderate) UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the 7.1 km Melbury Beacon walk across Fontmell and Melbury Downs in the UK. Open chalk downs, ridge views, and a summit at Melbury Beacon.
seo.h1: Melbury Beacon Walk on Fontmell and Melbury Downs – 7.1 km, Moderate
